terms.definition: Without other, exclusive; undivided attention. The mind not fragmented between desires. Essential for exclusive devotion (ananya-bhakti).
To serve with devotion, to worship completely. From *pari* (completely, around) + *upāsana* (sitting nearby, residing in). Implies complete surrounding presence in service.
Yoga = attainment; kṣema = preservation. Combined: the complete care of the devotee's welfare. The Lord supplies what is lacking and protects what is possessed.
I carry, I bear. The Lord acts as the personal porter of the devotee's needs. Not merely permission, but active carrying of burdens.
Endeavoring, struggling; one who makes effort toward self-control. Active striving practitioner. The one who attempts to command the senses.
Possessed of discrimination, wise, discerning. From *vi* (distinct) + *paśya* (seeing). One who sees clearly, discriminates between self and not-self.
Agitating, turbulent, violently active. From *pra* + *math* (to churn violently). The impetuous nature of the senses that drags the mind against its will.
Forcibly, violently, by force. The manner in which senses carry away the mind—against its will, despite discrimination.
